TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SecretClient extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The SecretClient provides synchronous and asynchronous methods to manage in the Azure Key Vault. The client supports creating, retrieving, updating, deleting, purging, backing up, restoring, and listing . The client also supports listing for a soft-delete enabled Azure Key Vault.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.param: A to the vault on which the client operates. Appears as "DNS Name" in the Azure portal. If you have a secret , use to parse the and other information. You should validate that this URI references a valid Key Vault resource. See for details.
A used to authenticate requests to the vault, such as DefaultAzureCredential.

Docs.summary: Backs up the specified secret.
Docs.remarks: Requests that a backup of the specified secret be downloaded to the client. All versions of the secret will be downloaded. This operation requires the secrets/backup permission.
Docs.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.

Docs.summary: Lists the properties of all enabled and disabled secrets in the specified vault. You can use the returned in subsequent calls to .
Docs.remarks: The Get Secrets operation is applicable to the entire vault. However, only the base secret identifier and its attributes are provided in the response. Individual secret versions are not listed in the response. This operation requires the secrets/list permission.
Docs.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.

Docs.summary: Lists the properties of all enabled and disabled versions of the specified secret. You can use the returned and in subsequent calls to .

remarks.para: The full secret identifier and attributes are provided in the response. No values are returned for the secrets. This operations requires the secrets/list permission.
Managed secrets may also be listed. They contain the certificate and private key for certificates stored in Key Vault.

Docs.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.

Docs.summary: Permanently deletes the specified secret.
Docs.remarks: The purge deleted secret operation removes the secret permanently, without the possibility of recovery. This operation can only be enabled on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the secrets/purge permission.
Docs.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.

Docs.param: The Secret object containing information about the secret and its properties. The properties secret.Name and secret.Value must be non null.
Docs.summary: Sets a secret in a specified key vault.
Docs.remarks: The set operation adds a secret to the Azure Key Vault. If the named secret already exists, Azure Key Vault creates a new version of that secret. This operation requires the secrets/set permission.
Docs.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.

Docs.summary: Recovers the deleted secret to the latest version.

Docs.remarks: Recovers the deleted secret in the specified vault. This operation can only be performed on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the secrets/recover permission.
Docs.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.

Docs.param: The secret object with updated properties.
Docs.summary: Updates the attributes associated with a specified secret.
Docs.remarks: The update operation changes specified attributes of an existing stored secret. Attributes that are not specified in the request are left unchanged. The value of a secret itself cannot be changed. This operation requires the secrets/set permission.
Docs.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.
